text: Eva, 45 and attractive, gets out of her old Prius, takes a large massage table and proceeds to carry it to the apartment building. She’s wearing sweatpants and sneakers ready for work.
A middle aged man, MARTIN, is enjoying his massage. Face gaping mouth and utterly relaxed, Eva works on his neck a shoulders from behind him.
Oh, yeah, right there, my neck. Perfect.
Take a deep breath and hold it a minute. (he does) Now, exhale. He lets out a long exhale and Eva almost falls over from BAD BREATH. She has to back up.
Good...
Should I do it again?
No, no. One is good.
Eva gives a massage to CYNTHIA, 35, who lies face down. Despite the soothing music, Cynthia talks loudly and constantly.

She brought cupcakes, I brought cake pops, and she goes “they’re the same thing” but they’re not the same thing because a cupcake is a cupcake, a cake pop is a cake with a stick in it. Anyway, the real issue is her daughter because she’s not very smart whereas my daughter Anna...
cynthia rolls over, continuing to talk. When she’s on her back Eva closes Cynthia's eyes.
Eva lugs her large massage table up the stairs to an apartment. It’s heavy and clumsy. The front door (at the of the stairs) opens up and HAL, 30, greets her.
Hey Eva. Come on up! He smiles and watches her struggle up the stairs, not helping.
A cute, well kept bungalow type place.
Eva is at her mirror putting on lipstick. Her daughter EL 18 and cute, comes in returning a necklace to the dresser
Hey mom. Where are you going?
To a party with Sarah and Will so they don't have to be alone. (beat) You want to come?
Why?
Because you’re leaving soon and we should hang out.
I’m good. She heads back into her own room.
Will (42) drives. His wife Sarah (40) sits beside him put on some makeup. Eva listens from the backseat as they exp something to her.
We can never find anything.
She puts things in the weirdest places. Like, if I leave my bracelets on the kitchen counter she’ll put them in a drawer in the kitchen. (to Will) Why can’t you just do it?
I always do it. I fired the gardener. It's not fair.
(to Eva) We want to fire her but he won’t do it. (to Will) It’s not hard for you. Why does it have to be fair?
You should do it because it’s hard for you.
oh, please.
Come on Sarah, grow up. You can fire a maid.
Is that the definition of maturity? Being able to fire your friggin’ maid?
(leaning forward, showing her lipstick) Sarah, does this color look good on me?
You look good. Pretty.
That's nice. Nice look.
Will, Sarah and Eva scan the large party and the beautifu back yard.
So whose party is this?
Well, he’s a big book agent and she’s an interior designer. They know everyone.
Maybe there’s single men here. Oh shit, I see a patient.
What are you going to do?
I don’t know. Ignore her until I can’t.
Show me. Introduce me!
No way.
You're a wet blanket. Oh, I see someone from my gym. Eva wanders off to say Hi to the gym woman, HILARY. She's standing with another very attractive and stylish woman, MARIANNE. Both are mid 40's.
Eva - hi. This is Marianne. This is Eva. Eva's a fabulous masseuse.
Oh! Nice to meet you.
Oh, will you guys excuse me for a sec? I've got to find a bathroom. She walks off leaving Marianne and Eva alone.
That was abrupt.
Wow, I love what you’re wearing. Your dress, and your shoes and your purse.
Oh, thanks. Gee, I should bring you everywhere. I love your outfit. So, you're a masseuse. And you're good?
I am.
What is it that you do?
I'm a poet.
And I’m a dreamer.
No. Really.
Oh. You - you're really a poet?
I am.
And you make a living?
I do!
You're a poet. Now I know it.
Good one.
Feel free to steal it!
Will standing alone, drinking. Eva walks up.
I think I just got a new client.
Where? Eva points. They see Marianne being fawned over by a COUP OF GUESTS. WILL (CONT’D) She looks clean.
She’s really nice. And funny. Great taste.
And extremely attractive.
You think every woman at this party is attractive.
Pretty much. Eva looks around.
There is not one man here that I’m attracted to. Just then TWO MEN approach Will. One is JASON, 50.
Will, didn’t know you'd be here!
Hey Jason. This is my friend Eva.
Hi. This is Albert. They all shake hands. ALBERT is 45 and has a bit of a bel
Nice party, huh? Lots of white balls hanging down.
Eva was just telling me that there’s not one man at this party that she’s attracted to.
Okay! I don’t know why you would make that announcement?
Is that unusual?
No, not unusual at all. And no offense.
(Joking) That's okay, I’m not attracted to anyone here, either.
Okay. Good. Yeah, it’s kind of an ugly crowd.
(making conversation) Jason, you've got a kid in college now, right?
Two.
I've got one leaving in the fall.
So do I.
It’s all I have.
Me too!
Oh come on, you guys. You want your kids to go away! It’s healthy!
Shut up.
Yeah, shut up. Albert looks at Eva, clearly charmed.
Sarah and Will drive home from the party, Eva is in the backseat.
Do all the guys get boners?
No.
Haven't we been over this?
Yes.
Massages make me nervous. I spend the whole time afraid I’m gonna get a boner.
You are?
So, do they hit on you?
You know you're starting to depress me. They don’t get boners and they don’t hit on me.
So, who do you massage? It must be so strange.
I've got a guy who’s got like a hundred stairs to his house and he never helps me with my massage table.
Did you ever ask him to?
I/She shouldn't have to! She gets out of the car.
Bye guys. Love you.

Eva gets out of the car, walks up to the house and opens front door. INT. ELLEN’S ROOM - NIGHT Ellen is asleep in her bed. Eva enters and stares at her child for a long, long time. It‘s unfathomable how much she loves this person.
Eva's car pulls into the parking lot. Ellen and Chloe get and immediately they trot off with THREE FRIENDS.
Bye mom!
(out the window) Have a good day honey.
Bye Eva, thanks for the ride!
Oh, you're welcome Chloe. Eva sees TWO OTHER GIRLS, MADDY and SAGE, dressed way too sexy, drop trash on the ground.
Hey. Maddy Price! You littered. Maddy turns and dead pans to Eva.
(in English accent) Excuse me, what did you say?
Pick up your trash. You're not British. Maddy picks up her trash.
What a bitch.
As Eva drives away - EXT. MARIANNE’S SANTA MONICA HOUSE - DAY Eva carries her massage table up to this beautiful Spanis house. It’s not big, but it’s special.
Bringing the table into the house, Eva admires the beauti place. It’s eclectic, colorful, creative, personal, perfe Fresh flowers everywhere, amazing art. Marianne wears a casual but chic outfit.
Come on in. Would you mind removing your shoes?
No problem.
And your socks too?
Sure.
Would you like some ice tea? Eva takes off her shoes and socks as Marianne slips into kitchen. She then appears with a glass of iced tea.
Oh yeah, that sounds good. I’m so glad you called. So many people take my card just to be polite!
Well, I’m not polite!
(looking around) Wow, this is soooo pretty! Can I live here? (sipping ice tea) And this tea is kind of fabulous!
Eva is working on Marianne while she lies on her back. Soothing music plays.
Eva is putting her table back together while Marianne wea casual clothes and sits on the couch. They’re mid conversation.
I'm dating this guy and he has no sense of humor.
Could be a deal breaker.
Right? I don’t know what to do because he’s very sweet.
Sweet can be good. Find someone else to tell you jokes.
Are you married?
Divorced. For ten years.
Are you guys still friends?
Not really. We share a daughter. Other than that it’s hard to believe I ever had a laugh with the guy, let alone create a child.
I know what you mean about your ex. We have zero in common. I don’t know how I ever had a real conversation with him.
Crazy, isn't it?
EXT. MARIANNE’S HOUSE - DAY Eva is putting her massage table in her car while Mariann clips herbs in her front yard.
Ill call you really soon. This left shoulder is still so tight.
You ought to ice it tonight. And drink lots of water. Stay hydrated.
I will. Thank you again. I’m so glad I met you! Oh, want some chervil? I’m drowning in it.
She hands her some herbs.
Eva sits in her kitchen eating lunch, VIDEO CHATTING WITH SARAH.
What the Hell is chervil? She said she was drowning in it.
An herb. (in American accent) An herb. How long have you known me?
I can’t understand a goddamned thing you ever say.
The furniture was gorgeous. I wanted everything in there.
Sarah sits at her desk (in her therapy office) VIDEO CHATTING.
She has no cellulite.
How can that be?
I don’t know! There’s nothing!
Anyway, Will said that some guy you met at the party wants your number! Jason’s friend I think. Eva smiles, in spite of herself.
But we both admitted we weren’t attracted to each other. (beat) What should I do? He’s kind of fat.
He is?
He's got this big belly.
Oh, come on. You have nothing to lose.
No, but he does. Ha Ha Ha. Sarah just stares at her. Suddenly Eva notices the little light on the wall go on behind Sarah.
Your patient just arrived. (beat) What if you never went out there. Would they just - (motions to shoot herself)? Oh, was that inappropriate?

TWELVE PEOPLE wait for a table outside a nondescript, sto front restaurant. Loud music blasts out onto the street f inside. Albert and Eva stand in front with the others, ma conversation. Everyone around them is YOUNG.
I’m sorry about this. I swear I made a dinner reservation.
Oh. That's okay. (beat) What about you? What do you do?
I work at The American Library of Cultural History.
The what?
Exactly. It’s basically a television library.
(concerned) You watch a lot of TV.
(smiles) No, no. Television history. What’s on now? I have no clue. I tried to watch a Housewives of Idiot Town and I wanted to jump off a building.
I watched one of those shows with my daughter once and I couldn’t believe it. They had no brains. And they all had fake cheekbones. And fake boobs. (beat) You like fake boobs?
I like real boobs.
I got real boobs.
(awkward pause) Well, that’s working out for us then.
They’re mid meal and haven‘t run out of things to say. Th have to shout to be heard.
How long have you been divorced?
About four years.
And was it mutual?
(embarrassed) Not really, no.
Uh uh. (beat) And can I get her number?
Of course.
Imagine the time it would save.
Sometimes I think we should all just wear signs around our necks. Get it all out there.
What would yours say?
I don’t know. I’m a slob? I have ear hair?
You know there’s ways to get rid of ear hair.
Fully aware. Taken care of.
A slob, huh?
Not the dirty, hoarder kind, just the normal kind.
Does your daughter live with you?
Half the time.
Does she mind your normal kind of mess?
I’m not that bad. But both she and her mother are very neat. They love that store - Christ - the empty box store?
The Container Store?
A whole store that sells crap to put your crap in so you can buy more crap.
I love that store. I love crap!
So did my ex wife. And she put it in very flowery and overpriced boxes.
They sell those in some manly designs, you know.
Manly designs?
Yeah, browns. Little cowboys.
Little cowboys? Well, if they did, my wife would have bought them for me because she tried very hard to domesticate me.
Living with someone else is not easy. Peoples habits.

Listen to this - (beat) I don’t like onions in my guacamole, right? So I would take a chip and kind of swirl it around until the onions were all on one side and then I could eat it. It drove her bananas.
Seems kind of harmless.
Completely. But by the end of our marriage it made her gag.
Well, that’s not nice. He notices her hands.
You have - um ~ lovely hands.
Oh. Thank you.
I would have thought - since you’re a masseuse that you would have big, manly hands but they’re actually very lovely.
(awkward) You have nice hands too.
(embarrassed) Thank you.
They‘re kind of like paddles. (beat) Did they just turn the music louder?
No, I think you just got older. Eva flags down a WAITER.
Excuse me, could you turn the music down a little bit? I’m old.
No, I’m sorry.
Are you sorry that I’m old, or that you won’t turn the music down?
We can’t change the volume. The waiter walks away.
He's nice.
I find I don’t like younger people.
(with her hand to her ear) Eh?
I'm sorry. I picked the wrong restaurant.
Oh I’m having a great time. The food is delicious. I mean I can’t hear anything you're saying.
That’s probably why you are having a great time.
Albert and Eva put toppings on their yogurts at the self serve bar. Albert lifts a spoonful of something red.
What is this, tomatoes?
That's watermelon! There’s some croutons next to it. He chuckles and dumps some candy in his bowl.
Doesn’t that sort of defeat the purpose?

What, it’s non fat yogurt. You can put a little stuff on it... She watches him dump more crap on and she smiles, amused. He looks at a COUPLE OF WOMEN looking very serious as the stand there tasting flavors out of little cups.
What? The people tasting?
You know, just put some in your bowl. You're not buying a house!
It's free.
Yes, it’s free. They're happy!
(laughing) They have to taste. There’s many variations. Cake Batter, Red Velvet. (reading a sign) I have no idea what that is. Albert pays for their cups and takes out a photo of his daughter.
This is my daughter. CLOSE UP ON A PHOTO OF A BEAUTIFUL 18 YEAR OLD GIRL.
Yowee. She’s gorgeous.

Looks like her mom, thank god. Eva turns on her phone and shows him a picture of Ellen. ALBERT (CONT’D) She's beautiful. (beat) You got any money?  ENOUGH SAID zu Flustered, Eva goes for her wallet. ALBERT (CONT’D) Just kidding. She laughs, relieved, as Albert takes out a twenty. INT. ALBERT’S AUDI - NIGHT Albert pulls his car up to Eva‘s house.
Well, I had a really nice time.
Me, too. Albert leans in for a kiss but Eva leans back.
I’m not sure.
Got it.
I mean, maybe.
I understand.
It's just that I’m not sure.
(playful) It's okay. I’m not deaf. (beat) Maybe a little deaf. She offers a hand and they shake.
I like your paddles. She moves to get out.
I like your ass. Flattered and embarrassed, Eva beams.  ENOUGH SAID a
Well, thank you. Albert can’t believe he just said that as she gets out of car, waving.
She drops her purse and flops down on the couch next to E and Chloe. They are in a discussion, flipping through magazines and eating snacks.
How was it?
Nice!
But what if he immediately hooks up with someone else? I/1l die.
So don't do it.
What?
Nothing.
I can't decide if I should sleep with Chris or not. We're going to separate colleges and I don’t want to do it if I'm gonna regret it later.
You're a virgin, right?
Don’t answer that.
(at same time) Yes.
You can’t live in fear of making a mistake. If you want to do it, you should do it.
Stay out of it.
She asked me!
She did?
Didn’t you Chloe? Chloe shrugs, stuck in the middle.
Eva sits on a couch outside the dressing rooms, knitting blanket. The girls are in a dressing room together.
That looks so cute!
You think?
(shouting to them) Show me! Come out!
I don’t like it. I’m gonna try this one.
Hey. I forgot to ask you. What happened to Maddy Price? She was such a bitch the other day.
She had a threesome with Sage Berger and Brendan Weiss and now she thinks she’s Taylor Momson.
Chloe! Don’t tell my mom that!
Your mom's cool.
No, she’s not.
She can tell me stuff. You never do! (stunned) They had a threesome?
Forget it mom!
What is happening? (beat) Have you guys done that?
Mom? Shut up.
That's such a pretty color. You look good.
Really? I think I like it.
Show me! They still ignore Eva.
Hello? I’m the one buying it. Ellen comes out and shows her.
You look beautiful! Chloe comes out wearing a tight short thing. Then her PRE MOTHER DEBBIE comes out of her own dressing room some distance away, wearing the same thing.
(surprised) Look at you guys.
No way.
What?
We‘re not buying the same dress, mom.
I won't wear it at the same time as you.
Come on. You look stupid.
I think I look good.
You're so lumpy. Debbie looks at Eva for support.
If I could wear that dress I would.
Thank you.
You would not. Mom you look crazy. Disgusted, Chloe heads back into the dressing room.
You’re not the only attractive girl in our family, Chloe.

Oh please! (beat) Why can’t you just dress like Ellen's mom? She looks normal! Debbie glances at Eva’s attire and rolls her eyes as she into the dressing room. Eva sits there in JEANS, SNEAKERS BAGGY SWEATER. Knitting. Oh well. EXT. MARIANNE’S PATIO - DAY Eva is setting up her massage stuff as Marianne lies on h back. She places a bolster under her knees.
(beat) So, what happened with your not-funny guy?
Over. It’s fine. What about you? Do you have a boyfriend?
I had a good first date over the weekend.
How nice. What’s he like?
(putting a pillow under Marianne’s neck) Funny, and very sweet. We never stopped talking. It felt like we were old friends already.
In a good way? ‘Cause that can sort of kill the chemistry.

No, it was good. Flirtatious. I wasn’t sure if I wanted to kiss him though, but I think I do. When I first met him he didn’t seem attractive to me. He’s not typically handsome. But now I think he’s kind of sexy. INT. EVA‘S CAR - DAY Eva looks at Albert’s house as she drives up and parks. EXT. ALBERT’S WESTWOOD HOUSE - DAY A 1930's somewhat neglected one story house. The lawn is and the paint is peeling. The curtains are drawn inside. Holding a bottle of cheap champagne, Eva exits her car an walks up to the house. After a beat, Albert comes to the wearing a sweatshirt and pajama bottoms.
Oh my god, did I get the day wrong?
No. Why?
You're wearing pajamas.
I’m not.
oh.
I just like to be comfortable. You know, it’s brunch, it’s Sunday.
Oh, good! INT. ALBERT’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS It’s dark everywhere, all of the windows are shaded with curtains or blinds. He takes the champagne.

Thank you for this. I’1l make mimosas. Despite the dark, cave-like quality, it’s nice. Newish furniture, lots of books, an enormous flat screen TV. The are PHOTOS of TESS everywhere. Eva picks up a Chanel purse sitting on the table.
You carry a purse?
That's my daughter's. Outrageously expensive but it was her 18th birthday.
Bagels and coffee are ready and waiting on the counter. Albert makes drinks.
Bagels! I love bread! So, tell me about her - your daughter, I mean.
Well, she’s very sophisticated - as you can tell from the pocketbook.
She's smart, lovely and funny ~ and she’s moving to New York. Very far away. Going to Parsons school of design. I’m very proud of her.
I bet.

But part of me thinks I shouldn’t let her go. You know? She’s 18 and this is a great opportunity for her but what if something happens to her while she’s in New York. I’1l never be able to forgive myself.

The whole going away to college thing. We send them off? We don’t know where they are all the time? And aside from that, what’s my life going to look like when she’s gone? Lonely and pointless! (beat) Do you know that she doesn’t even want her father or me to take her there? She wants to say good-bye at the airport. Here. Not even fly with her.
That’s horrible.
Heartbreaking, that’s the word for it. I guess we better develop hobbies.
Yeah. I guess so.
I suppose I already have one. I knit. I'll just knit for the rest of my life. That’s my plan. What about you?
That's funny, because I weave.
(taken aback) Like baskets?
Yeah, I do it in the garage.
Really?
(beat) No. She cracks up.
What would make you think that I would weave?
I don’t know! I’m actually kind of glad you don't weave.

Me, too. Then she looks down at Albert’s crotch and quickly looks away. ALBERT (CONT‘D) You know, I try to picture her not being here. I don’t see her all the time anyway, but it will completely different.
Look, I can see your penis.
What?
(looking away) I saw your penis. Your pajama thing is kind of open. Albert instantly drops his hand to cover himself. He’s mortified. After a minute, he jokes.
Whaddya think?
I think you’re very... healthy.
Thank you.
Go change your pants, okay?
Be right back. EXT. ALBERT’S BACKYARD - A BIT LATER Albert (in jeans) and Eva are drinking champagne. Albert in an old chair and Eva is on the ground pulling up weeds
So, what happened? I don’t mean the details, just the general.

I don’t think she liked me very much. We never had sex - not my choice, she just had no interest in it whatsoever. I’m pretty sure she cheated on me. That was awful. So obviously she liked sex but just not with me. She thought my job was stupid. I didn’t understand her. We parented very differently. Fought about it, always. (beat) Why are you wrecking my back yard?
You have a lot of weeds.
I do? Where?
These are all weeds.
I thought all that was good. He gets down on the grass and helps her.

(beat) We never had sex either ~ not his choice. We were pretty out of synch in that way. (beat) We were out of synch with Ellen too. A lot of fighting over how to parent. (looking over) That’s all good grass you’re pulling up.
I'll put it back.
He tries to replant it. Eva kicks off her shoes and rubs of her blistered feet.
(beat) Got some kind of blister thing going there?
I guess.
Yup.
You're grossed out.
No, no.
You are. You’re freaked by my feet.
I have a little problem with feet. I think it has to do with my mother.
Oh, she had feet.
Let’s just say they were overly colorful, like a rainbow. Yellow, blue ~ veins and blisters... She stares at him, then moves to put her shoe back on.
You don’t have to do that.
I think I should. (beat) I've never even had a pedicure. I know everyone has but I just never saw the point, until this actual moment. Plus I’m really ticklish.
Want me to get you a band-aid?
Please. And maybe a bag for my foot.
Stop it.
Make it two bags. Two bags for the old bag!
I knew I shouldn't have told you! He goes into the house and Eva examines her foot.
Eva is putting a couple of band aids on her foot. They’re conversation.
They’re naked, right?
Yeah.
Are you ever attracted to them?
(here we go) No. Never.
Well, I’m sure they’re attracted to you.
I don’t know. They’re getting massaged.
They must hit on you all the time.
(lying) Sometimes. Yeah. (beat) I'll give you a massage sometime, if you like.
I would like that. I would definitely hit on you.
I think that might be okay.
Really. (beat) Want to kiss? They look at one another for a bit.

sure. And they do. INT. ALBERT’S BEDROOM - THAT DAY Eva and Albert lie under the covers, having just had sex. Albert's bedroom is very sparse and lacks night stands. A of his stuff - books, tissues, clock ~ lays on the floor beside the bed. Eva reaches down for a glass of water.
You didn’t actually open your eyes at any point, did you?
No, no worries. I figured if I kept my eyes closed you wouldn’t see me.
I saw you. He pulls her to him.
I'm tired of being funny.
Me too. They lie there for a minute not talking.
But you’re not funny. He smiles.
Sarah and Eva are pushing a heavy piece of furniture acro the room. They’re getting help from Sarah’s son BRANDON ( and her daughter GRACE, (6), as well.
I’m so excited for you! He sounds great.
He kind of is. (whispering) We had such good sex.
How fun! I can’t even imagine. Sarah stands back and looks at the furniture’s new spot.
What do you think?
I liked it where it was. You’re going to get a hernia.
(to her kids) You guys can be done. Brandon and Grace walk into the other room.
No Cleveland Show.
(without turning around) Please.
Please.
Okay.
Jeez, you really put your foot down.
Too tired to be a good parent.
Maybe stop moving furniture around.
Sarah flops down on the couch, picking up a decorating magazine. Sarah's maid CATHY, 30 and Hispanic, walks by straighteni up.
What’s she doing here?

(talking quietly) You have no idea. Will refused to fire her so I let it go for a while hoping she’d just get better, but she got worse. She even seemed like she wanted to be fired cuz she was doing such stupid things.
Well, good.
So I fired her and she started crying. And then I started crying and then we were hugging and then I hired her back.
You're nice.
Right? Some people might think that I’m compassionate or soft hearted or whatever, but Will just thinks I’m a baby. He wants me to fire her again as a learning experience.
Jesus.
That’s our relationship, right there.
Oh come on, it’s so much more than that.
Whatever. He’s an jerk. He was a middle child and never got enough fried chicken at the dinner table and thinks everything has to be fair. Cathy appears.
Mrs. Sarah. Where do you want me to put this? It was in the bathroom. She holds up a ping pong paddle.
Outside? With the ping pong table.
Okay, no problem. She goes off and the two share a smile.
Albert's car is parked behind Eva’s in the driveway.
Albert and Eva, only half awake, are sitting up in bed. E mouth is wide open and Albert is looking inside it.
I've never actually seen wisdom teeth. I didn’t think anyone had them. You have a lot of fillings.
Do they look like the mercury kind?
No. Just normal fillings and a couple of crowns. Eva closes her mouth.
Okay, your turn.
No.
Come on. (seductive) Open your mouth.
Make me. She kisses him and he immediately opens up.
You're missing a tooth!
I am.
It's way back there. You can’t see it.
I've got to get some kind of hideous bone graft and it costs a fortune and I’ve been putting it off.
Yeah, my grandma Dee Dee had that.
Exactly. Grandma Dee Dee. Thank you for that. They kiss when suddenly they hear footsteps.
Huh? Chloe is standing at the bedroom door.
Oh my god I’m so sorry.
Hi honey.
I didn’t know...
This is Chloe, Ellen’s best friend. This is Albert.
Hi.
Ellen didn’t answer my texts so I thought she was sleeping.
She's at her dad’s. You okay?
Yeah, I just wanted to go out to breakfast.
(turning to Albert) You hungry?
Albert, Eva and Chloe are eating breakfast.
So if I tell you a day and a year you'll know what was on?
Shoot.
That's crazy! No way. (beat) 1975, channel 4.
What time?
Oh, come on.
Saturday morning.

Woody Woodpecker, then Pink Panther then McDuff The Talking Dog - I didn’t like it but watched it anyway, Monster Squad - Land of the Lost and then Big John, Little John, which was like “Big” only weirder.
And I thought I watched a lot of TV.
I really looked forward to the line up.
What, were you rejected as a child?
Well, I was kind of raised like a veal. I was put in a dark room and fed and told not to move. They crack up.
Eva is giving the guy with bad breath, Martin, a massage. mouth breaths as he lies on his back, mouth gaping.
The chatterbox is lying on her back as Eva works on her l

So I said ‘I guess that means you don’t like it’ and she says ‘no, I just might want another size’ but it was definitely her size because she’s petite and big on the top but the thing is I bought it at Nordstrom Rack but I put it in a Neiman Marcus box
At the house where the guy doesn’t help her - Eva is pull her massage table up the stairs.
(to herself) That's right, don’t open the door. Pretend you don’t know I’m here...
They walk among the stacks of scripts and audio/video stu

We have the most comprehensive collection of television shows from 1947 to the present. I make sure things are transferred properly, logged properly.
